Package rover

Class Navigator

java.lang.Object
rover.Navigator
public class Navigator
extends java.lang.Object
A navigator is the central control of the rover's movements. It is a redefinition of the Navigator class from leJOS which appears to be behaving not as intented. Same methods will be redefined here to adapt better to our setup and the current task we have been given.
Author:
Antoine Stevan

  • Method Details

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(float angle)
      Rotates the rover from a given angle, in degrees. During the process, the heading of the rover is updated.
      Parameters:
      angle - the relative angle, in degrees.

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(double angle)
      Wrapper of the Navigatorrotate(float) method.
      Parameters:
      angle - the relative angle, in degrees.

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(float angle, boolean immediate_return)
      Rotates the rover from a given angle, in degrees. During the process, the heading of the rover is updated.
      Parameters:
      angle - the relative angle, in degrees.
      immediate_return - if true, the execution continues, allowing the user to do other stuff during rotation. Otherwise, the program halts and waits for the rotation to end.

    • rotate

      public void rotate​(double angle, boolean immediate_return)
      Wrapper of the NavigatorrotateTo(float, boolean) method.
      Parameters:
      angle - the relative angle, in degrees.
      immediate_return - if true, the execution continues, allowing the user to do other stuff during rotation. Otherwise, the program halts and waits for the rotation to end.

    • setup_rotate

      public void setup_rotate​(int angle)
      Sets up a rotation for the rover. During the setup, a rotation with immediate return is launched and tacho counts are reset for future computations. After a rotation, setup here, one should consider using compute_new_heading() to update the heading of the rover using tachometers.
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle of rotation, in degrees.

    • setup_rotate

      public void setup_rotate​(float angle)
      Wrapper of the setup_rotate(int) method.
      Parameters:
      angle - the angle of rotation, in degrees.
      See Also:
      setup_rotate(int)

    • compute_new_heading

      public void compute_new_heading()
      Computes a new location, assuming straight travel, from previous location, using tacho counts.
      See Also:
      setup_travel(int)

    • rotateTo

      public void rotateTo​(float angle)
      Rotates the rover to a given angle, in degrees. During the process, the heading of the rover is updated.
      Parameters:
      angle - the absolute angle, in degrees.

    • rotateTo

      public void rotateTo​(float angle, boolean immediate_return)
      Rotates the rover to a given angle, in degrees. During the process, the heading of the rover is updated.
      Parameters:
      angle - the absolute angle, in degrees.
      immediate_return - if true, the execution continues, allowing the user to do other stuff during rotation. Otherwise, the program halts and waits for the rotation to end.

    • travel

      public void travel​(float length)
      The rover travels a certain distance. During the process, the location of the rover is updated.
      Parameters:
      length - the relative distance, in m.

    • travel

      public void travel​(double length)
      Wrapper of the Navigatortravel(float) method.
      Parameters:
      length - the relative distance, in m.

    • travel

      public void travel​(float length, boolean immediate_return)
      The rover travels a certain distance. During the process, the location of the rover is updated.
      Parameters:
      length - the relative distance, in m.
      immediate_return - if true, the execution continues, allowing the user to do other stuff during travel. Otherwise, the program halts and waits for the travel to end.

    • setup_travel

      public void setup_travel​(int length)
      Sets up a travel for the rover. During the setup, a travel with immediate return is launched and tacho counts are reset for future computations. After a travel, setup here, one should consider using compute_new_location() to update the location of the rover using tachometers.
      Parameters:
      length - the length of the travel, in m.

    • setup_travel

      public void setup_travel​(float length)
      Wrapper of the setup_travel(int) method.
      Parameters:
      length - the length of the travel, in m.
      See Also:
      setup_travel(int)

    • compute_new_location

      public lejos.robotics.geometry.Point compute_new_location()
      Computes a new location, assuming straight travel, from previous location, using tacho counts.
      Returns:
      the vector representing the travel, from previous location to the new one.
      See Also:
      setup_travel(int)

    • forward

      public void forward()
      Forces all the motors to go forward.

    • isMoving

      public boolean isMoving()
      Tells if the rover is currently moving.
      Returns:
      true if at least one of the motor is moving, false if it is otherwise at rest.

    • add_dist

      public void add_dist​(float dist)
      Adds a certain distance to the current location. The virtual move is performed along the direction of the rover, indicated by its heading.
      Parameters:
      dist - the distance of the update, in m.

    • goTo

      public void goTo​(lejos.robotics.geometry.Point point)
      Deprecated.
      one should consider using a combination of rotation and travel instead.
      Performs a blocking goto to a point.
      Parameters:
      point - the goal of the goto

    • goTo

      public void goTo​(lejos.robotics.geometry.Point point, boolean immediate_return)
      Deprecated.
      one should consider using a combination of rotation and travel instead.
      Performs a blocking goto
      Parameters:
      point - the goal of the goto
      immediate_return - if true, the execution continues, allowing the user to do other stuff during goto. Otherwise, the program halts and waits for the goto to end.
